author: mklement0
body:
Steps to reproduce ------------------ ```powershell 'one', 'two' | ConvertTo-Html -Property @{ l='Name'; e={ $_ } } ``` Expected behavior ----------------- ```html HTML TABLE
Name
one
two
``` This is how it has always worked in Windows PowerShell. The property name becomes the column header (`th`), and the values the column data (`td`). Actual behavior --------------- ```html HTML TABLE
Name
``` Note how the `` elements are unexpectedly empty. Environment data ---------------- ```powershell PowerShell Core v6.1.0-preview.2 on macOS 10.13.4 PowerShell Core v6.1.0-preview.2 on Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS PowerShell Core v6.1.0-preview.2 on Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64-bit; Version 1709, OS Build: 16299.371) ```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: /cc @SteveL-MSFT Can we consider this as bug?

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
@iSazonov: 

To me the feature is (a) obviously broken in and of itself (I added a bit more detail) and (b) a regression from Windows PowerShell, so let me ask the opposite question: why _wouldn't_ this be a bug?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @mklement0 If it's a regression then it's definitely a bug.

title: Passing calculated properties to ConvertTo-Html is broken
